text:
In the sentence below, the word that recieves the emphatic stress is written in capital letters. From the words lettered A to D, choose the one to which the given sentence is the appropriate answer.

The Nigerian FOOTBALL team has many foreign players.

options.A: Does the South African football team have many foreign players?
options.B: Does the Nigerian volleyball team have many foreign players?
options.C: Does the Nigerian football team have foreign players?
options.D: Does the Nigerian football team have many foreign coaches?

explanation: In responding to questions on emphatic stress in examinations, interrogative sentences will be provided as options. The interrogative sentence that contradicts the emphasised word is the correct option. Option B is the correct answer here because the word ''Volleyball contradicts Football''.

text:
In the sentence below, the word that recieves the emphatic stress is written in capital letters. From the words lettered A to D, choose the one to which the given sentence is the appropriate answer.

John must PAY for the broken glass immediately.

options.A: Must Jane pay for the broken glass immediately?
options.B: must John repair the broken glass immediately?
options.C: must John pay for the broken glass immediately?
options.D: must John pay for broken glass immediately?

explanation: In responding to questions on emphatic stress, Interrogative sentence that contradicts the emphasized word is the correct option. This means that, the statement that does not have the emphasized word in it is the correct answer. Option B is the correct answer here because the word ''Repair contradicts Pay''.

text:
In the sentence below, the word that recieves the emphatic stress is written in capital letters. From the words lettered A to D, choose the one to which the given sentence is the appropriate answer.

The workers agreed to forgo their DECEMBER salaries.

options.A: Did the workers agree to forgo their December salaries?
options.B: Did the workers refuse to forgo their December salaries?
options.C: Did the workers agree to claim their December salaries?
options.D: Did the workers agree to forgo their March salaries?

explanation: In responding to questions on emphatic stress, Interrogative sentence that contradicts the emphasized word is the correct option. This means that, the statement that does not have the emphasized word in it is the correct answer. Option D is the correct answer here because the word ''March contradicts December''.

text:
In the sentence below, the word that recieves the emphatic stress is written in capital letters. From the words lettered A to D, choose the one to which the given sentence is the appropriate answer.

The landlord refused to eject the TENANT.

options.A: Did the caretaker agree to eject the tenant?
options.B: Did the landlord refuse to eject the tenant?
options.C: Did the landlord refuse to acept the tenant?
options.D: Did the landlord refuse to eject the guest?

explanation: Inresponding to questions on emphatic stressin examinations, interrogative sentences will be provided as options. The interrogative sentence that contradicts the emphasised word is the correct option. Option D is the correct answer here because the word ''Guest contradicts Tenant''.

text:
In the sentence below, the word that recieves the emphatic stress is written in capital letters. From the words lettered A to D, choose the one to which the given sentence is the appropriate answer.

The principal REBUKED the teachers for lateness.

options.A: Did the governor rebuke the teachers for lateness?
options.B: Did the principal commend the teachers for lateness?
options.C: Did the principal rebuke the students for lateness?
options.D: Did the principal rebuke the teachers for negligience?

explanation: Inresponding to questions on emphatic stressin examinations, interrogative sentences will be provided as options. The interrogative sentence that contradicts the emphasized word is the correct option. Option B contradicts the emphasized word ''Rebuked'', instead ''commend'' was used, which makes it the correct answer.

Cash in on; means take advantage of or exploit (a situation).

explanation: If you have no choicebutto do something or have little choice but to do it, you cannot avoid doing it. They hadlittle choice butto agree to what he suggested.

text:
From the words or group of words lettered A to D, choose the word or group of words that best completes the sentence.

Each of the winners ........ to receive five thousand dollars.
explanation:
The correct option to complete the sentence is:
B. is
So the complete sentence would be: "Each of the winners is to receive five thousand dollars."
In this sentence, "each" is an indefinite pronoun and indefinite pronouns are treated as singular pronouns, so it should be followed by the singular form of the verb, which is "is."
